page.title: 06STEAMTOWN RAILWAY MUSEUM
page.content: One of the main attractions of Carnforth, which is visited by 80,000 people a year, is{Steamtown.}The railway museum is 15 years old and was started by a group of volunteers who opened it in 1970. It is owned by{The {Steamtown Company.}The oldest train is the{Lindsay}which is 98 years old. There are 35 trains at{Steamtown}20 of them are still in use. The fastest train at{Steamtown}is the{Sir Nigel {Gresley}known as the {Blue Whale.}The newest train is the{Firefly}which was built in 1956.The most famous train at {Steamtown}is{The Flying Scotsman, } built in Doncaster in 1923 and often in steam.The most common engines are the four{Black Fives.}Also interesting is the S.N.C.F.{Pacific,}built in France in 1914 and weighing 176 tons. There are also eight small trains and a working model railway of 14 engines.
